stimulusHtml:
The distribution of long jump distance in a statewide high school league is approximately normal with a mean of 18.5 feet and a standard deviation of 3.2 feet. Two students, Joshua and Mateo, from this league competed in the long jump. Joshua’s distance was 0.52 standard deviation below the mean of the distribution. Mateo’s distance was at the 48th percentile of the distribution.

At approximately what percentile was the distance jumped by Joshua, and how did his distance compare to Mateo’s distance?
choicesHtml: Joshua’s distance was at the 30th percentile of the distribution and was less than Mateo’s distance.
Joshua’s distance was at the 30th percentile of the distribution and was greater than Mateo’s distance.
Joshua’s distance was at the 48th percentile of the distribution and was less than Mateo’s distance.
Joshua’s distance was at the 48th percentile of the distribution and was greater than Mateo’s distance.
Joshua’s distance was at the 70th percentile of the distribution and was greater than Mateo’s distance.
